alert.note: Alert for Bland; Tazewell (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 06 at 5:47PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Tazewell, north central Bland and southern Mercer Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 546 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Ceres, or near Bluefield, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bluefield... Princeton... Athens... Rocky Gap... Pocahontas... Bramwell... and Oakvale. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for southwestern Virginia. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for southwestern Virginia...and southeastern West Virginia.
